page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Cromhall is in Gloucestershire between Bristol and Wotton-Under-Edge near the Cotswold Hills.It lies on the B4058. The name is derived from the Old English word crumb, meaning bend, and halh, a hook of land. It consists of four scattered hamlets,with the church left seemingly isolated. There are 210 houses, farms, a shop/post office ,chapel, school, pub and two quarries. There is some woodland, ponds, and a stream, but most of the land is agricultural. There is a playing field, green, and swings. Clubs include, Brounies and Cubs, Tearaways, Keep Fit and the W.I.
